abstract: brazen gang smash into post office and drag cashpoint from wall .
article: the raiders smashed their way into a post office in the leafy suburb while the region was hit by a barrage of snowa gang has brazenly targeted a hole-in-the-wall in hampton-in-arden . the raiders smashed their way into a post office in the leafy suburb while the region was hit by a barrage of snow . temperatures plunged towards the freezing mark as the ram-raiders struck . they dragged the cashpoint out of the wall just before 2 am on monday . they left a gaping hole in the front of the post office and general store , in the village high street , reports the birmingham mail .

no-one was injured in the robbery but up to Â£ 3,000 was understood to have been stolen . the store would not comment . dogs sniff out hundreds of illegal cigarette packets in coventry shoptwo men were jailed over a pre-christmas raid at the same post office six years ago . a spokesman for west midlands police said : `` a large quantity of cash was stolen during a ram raid at hampton in arden post office on the high street just before 2 am on monday 11 december . `` a cash machine was taken during the raid which smashed the front bay window . ''

police were trawling through cctv and parts of the vehicle 's bodywork was being forensically examined . anyone with information should call police on 101 or crimestoppers , in confidence , on 0800 555 111 .
